answerText: d-orbitals[10] This hexadentate chelating agent forms coordination complexes with metal ions in a solution, and it can be used in complexometric titration to sequester aqueous cations.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | WUSTL, Haverford, Bellarmine A | 20 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] These orbitals on metal ions are subject to crystal field splitting. The spectrochemical series arranges ligands by how much they split these orbitals which come between p-orbitals and f-orbitals.
